interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: My Spy Review Date: 2020/09/18 Categories: Young Adult Audience, Comedy, Charming, Optimistic Product Description: ['My Spy follows JJ, a hardened CIA operative (Dave Bautista), who has been demoted and finds himself at the mercy of a precocious 9-year old girl named Sophie (Chloe Coleman) after he is sent undercover to surveil her family. In exchange for not blowing JJ’s cover, Sophie uses her charm and wit to convince him to spend time with her and teach her to be a spy.'] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Italiano', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Français', 'Italiano', 'Nederlands'], 'Directors': ['Peter Segal'], 'Producers': ['Peter Segal', 'Chris Bender', 'Jake Weiner', 'Robert Simonds', 'Gigi Pritzker', 'Dave Bautista', 'Jonathan Meisner'], 'Starring': ['Dave Bautista', 'Chloe Coleman', 'Ken Jeong']} Review Text: My Spy is a fun "movie of the week" type flick. Its a light, action, and amusing family comedy (with a bit of too much violence for younglings).
JJ is a hardened CIA spy that has been demoted and finds himself at the mercy of a precocious 9-year-old girl, named Sophie where he has been sent undercover begrudgingly to surveil her family. Despite his reluctance, JJ finds he is no match for Sophie's disarming charm and wit. There has been many similiar such stories before, but I found this one a bit refreshing & cute. Keeps you entertained throughout the film. I do recommend. Review Title: Fun watch for the whole family Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Star Wars: Attack of the Clones (Feature) Ewan McGregor (Actor), Natalie Portman (Actor), George Lucas (Director, Writer) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ["Watch the seeds of Anakin Skywalker's transformation take root in Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones. Ten years after the invasion of Naboo, the galaxy is on the brink of civil war. Under the leadership of a renegade Jedi named Count Dooku, thousands of solar systems threaten to break away from the Galactic Republic. When an assassination attempt is made on Senator Padme Amidala, the former Queen of Naboo, twenty-year-old Jedi apprentice Anakin Skywalker is assigned to protect her. In the course of his mission, Anakin discovers his love for Padme as well as his own darker side. Soon, Anakin, Padme, and Obi-Wan Kenobi are drawn into the heart of the Separatist movement and the beginning of the Clone Wars."] {'Genre': 'Action/Adventure', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Frank Oz, Christopher Lee, Jonathan Hales, Kenny Baker, Silas Carson, Natalie Portman, Samuel L. Jackson, George Lucas, Temuera Morrison, Ewan McGregor, Leeanna Walsman, Ronald Falk, Ahmed Best, Hayden Christensen, Pernilla August, Ian McDiarmid, Oliver Ford Davies, Jimmy Smits, Anthony Daniels, Jack ThompsonFrank Oz, Christopher Lee, Jonathan Hales, Kenny Baker, Silas Carson, Natalie Portman, Samuel L. Jackson, George Lucas, Temuera Morrison, Ewan McGregor, Leeanna Walsman, Ronald Falk, Ahmed Best, Hayden Christensen, Pernilla August, Ian McDiarmid, Oliver Ford… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'B07TQYSBQB', 'Director': 'George Lucas', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '2 hours and 22 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 22, 2019', 'Actors': 'Ewan McGregor, Natalie Portman, Hayden Christensen, Frank Oz, Ian McDiarmid', 'Dubbed': 'French, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Studio': 'LUCASFILM', 'Writers': 'George Lucas, Jonathan Hales', 'Number of discs': '1'} Very entertaining. This is the second prequel to the original Star Wars trilogy takes place ten years after the events of Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace. Nice action, great duels. Fun & exciting. Poor acting though and the CGI animation was still in the infancy stage. It was fun watching Anakin as a hot tempered impatient teenager. LoL.

A must have DVD for your Star Wars collection. Great movie. Great Star Wars scenes. {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Jodie Foster', 'So Yong Kim', 'Charlie McDowell', 'Tim Mielants', 'Mark Romanek', 'Andrew Stanton', 'Dearbhla Walsh', 'Ti West'], 'Producers': ['Nathaniel Halpern', 'Matt Reeves', 'Rafi Crohn', 'Adam Kassan', 'Mark Romanek', 'Mattias Montero', 'Samantha Taylor Pickett', 'Adam Berg', 'Robert Petrovicz', 'Simon Stalenhag', 'Mark Lafferty', 'Ellen Rutter'], 'Starring': ['Rebecca Hall', 'Paul Schneider', 'Duncan Joiner']} Slow moving, a bit weired, sci-fi story that leaves you with some important unaswered questions. I love scifi but many films and stories just can't cut it. I thought I would not even get through the first episode. But the more I watched it the more interesting it got. Each episode is its own story, but is also connected to the people and events of all the other episodes. The last eposide really got to me and was in tears. No spoilers, watch them all. The only dislike or warning is: no true details or explanations given for many things that happen in this show. very little true back stories or explanations.
If you found my review helpful, kindly vote below so I can improve my future reviews. In exchange for not blowing JJ’s cover, Sophie uses her charm and wit to convince him to spend time with her and teach her to be a spy.'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Italiano', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Français', 'Italiano', 'Nederlands'], 'Directors': ['Peter Segal'], 'Producers': ['Peter Segal', 'Chris Bender', 'Jake Weiner', 'Robert Simonds', 'Gigi Pritzker', 'Dave Bautista', 'Jonathan Meisner'], 'Starring': ['Dave Bautista', 'Chloe Coleman', 'Ken Jeong']} My Spy is a fun "movie of the week" type flick. Its a light, action, and amusing family comedy (with a bit of too much violence for younglings).
JJ is a hardened CIA spy that has been demoted and finds himself at the mercy of a precocious 9-year-old girl, named Sophie where he has been sent undercover begrudgingly to surveil her family. Despite his reluctance, JJ finds he is no match for Sophie's disarming charm and wit. There has been many similiar such stories before, but I found this one a bit refreshing & cute. Keeps you entertained throughout the film. I do recommend. Fun watch for the whole family
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user maintains a strong preference for science fiction and action/adventure genres in movies and TV series, showing enthusiasm for iconic franchises with significant cultural impact, such as Star Wars. They are also open to light-hearted family comedies, reflecting a broadening of their genre interests.

- **Content Consumption:** This user enjoys engaging narratives featuring well-known actors and directors, often rating content highly (typically around 4.5 to 5.0). They appreciate strong performances and compelling stories, even recognizing merit in lighter fare while staying critical of excessive production flaws.

- **Engagement Style:** Their thoughtful reviews balance positive aspects (entertaining content, character connections) with constructive criticism (lack of detailed explanations or backstories). They show a willingness to engage with slower narratives and light-hearted stories.

- **Community Involvement:** The user values community insights and shared experiences, interacting with creators and actors in the media they consume.

- **Favorite Elements:** They appreciate character development and emotional storytelling, particularly in iconic hero narratives, while their recent feedback suggests enjoyment of charming, optimistic plots, even with familiar tropes.

- **Collecting Habits:** Positively responds to collectible formats like Blu-ray and seeks to complete collections of beloved film series.

Overall, this user exhibits a nuanced appreciation for cinematic storytelling, embracing both the entertainment value and the complexity of narratives across a variety of genres.
